text:
An unclaimed bag at a railway station here on Tuesday sparked a security scare, but it was later found that it contained clothes and was mistakenly left behind by a soldier.

After the bag was found at around 11.30 am, people were swiftly evacuated from the area, and rail traffic was halted on the route in the district where the police and other agencies have been on high alert following the terror strike at the air base early this month.

Bomb disposal and dog squads were summoned to identify the contents of the bag.

Bag belonged to jawan

Pathankot SSP R.K. Bakshi said sleuths found that the bag contained uniform, shoes and other articles of an Army jawan. “We have established the identity of the jawan,” he said.

Officials of the Punjab police and the Government Railway Police said the bag, wrapped in a black cloth, had been left behind by the jawan who had alighted at the railway station.

“We took no chance and immediately halted the rail traffic on the route. The railway station was also vacated,” Mr. Bakshi said.

Punjab is already on high alert after the January 2 Pathankot air base terror attack in which seven security personnel were killed.. — PTI

title: Unclaimed bag sparks scare at Pathankot railway station
